Package com.ibm.streams.management.job

Interface OperatorMXBean

public interface OperatorMXBean
OperatorMXBean provides attributes, operations, and notifications for managing an operator of a Streams job.

Note: The job must be registered before accessing any of these attributes or operations. See InstanceMXBean.registerJob(BigInteger) for more information.

ObjectNameBuilder.operator(String, String, BigInteger, String) can be used to build the ObjectName for a OperatorMXBean.

Notifications:
An OperatorMXBean supports sending the following notifications:

Notifications.OPERATOR_CONNECTION_ADDED
Notifications.OPERATOR_CONNECTION_REMOVED

Notification categories:
These categories can be used with notification filters to easily filter out all notifications in a category.
Notifications.OPERATOR_NOTIFICATION

The JobMXBean snapshot and PeMXBean snapshot operations provide an option to include attributes of descendant objects in the generated snapshot. If the value of the maximumDepth parameter identifies operator attributes should be included in the snapshot, the JSON format of the operator information returned is described in the product documentation. See topic: REST management API reference > Get operator. The following differences exist for the JMX output:

  • The REST specific properties: resourceType, restid, and self are not included.
  • The related domain, instance, job, and pe attributes are not repeated for the operator.
  • The connections, metrics, and host properties are not included.
  • The inputPorts and outputPorts properties are only included if the maximumDepth parameter on the submit call indicates they should be included. The value for each of these properties is an embedded array containing snapshot objects for each immediate child of the operator. For the format of these objects, see: OperatorInputPortMXBean OperatorInputPortMXBean

  • Method Details

    • getChannel

      Integer getChannel()
      Returns the channel of the parallel region that tuple data is routed through. If the operator is nested within multiple parallel regions, the value is the channel index of the innermost parallel region. The value is null if the operator is not parallelized.

      Note: This attribute is not included in the snapshot on a JobMXBean.snapshot(int, boolean) or a JobMXBean.snapshot(int, boolean) call if the operator is not part of a parallel region or if includeStaticAttributes is false.

      Returns:
      the parallel region channel index.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • getChannels()

    • getChannels

      List<ParallelChannel> getChannels()
      Returns information about the channels of the parallel regions used to route tuple data for this operator. The returned channel information is ordered with the innermost region information first and the outermost last. The list is empty if the operator is not parallelized.

      Note: This attribute is not included in the snapshot on a JobMXBean.snapshot(int, boolean) or a JobMXBean.snapshot(int, boolean) call if the operator is not part of a parallel region or if includeStaticAttributes is false.

      Returns:
      the parallel region channel information.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • ParallelChannel

    • getConnections

      Set<String> getConnections()
      Returns the connection identifiers for connections with either the source or target port contained by this operator. The connection identifier can be used on the ObjectNameBuilder.operatorConnection(String, String, String) call to get the ObjectName of the managed bean for the operator connection.
      Returns:
      the connection identifiers.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

      String getDomain()
      Returns the identifier for the domain to which the operator belongs.
      Returns:
      String the domain identifier.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.

    • getExceptionPorts

      Set<Integer> getExceptionPorts()
      Returns the indexes of the exception output ports within the operator. These are zero-based indexes.
      Returns:
      the exception port indexes.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • getIndexWithinJob

      int getIndexWithinJob()
      Returns the index of the operator within the job. This is a zero-based index.
      Returns:
      the operator index within the job.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • getLogicalName

      String getLogicalName()
      Returns the logical name of the operator. This name does not vary when the operator is parallelized.

      Note: This attribute is not included in the snapshot on a JobMXBean.snapshot(int, boolean) or a JobMXBean.snapshot(int, boolean) call if the operator is not part of a parallel region or if includeStaticAttributes is false.

      Returns:
      the logical operator name.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • getName()

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns the physical name of the operator. The physical name is unique for each duplicated operator running in separate parallel region when an operator has been parallelized.
      Returns:
      the physical operator name.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:

      Note: This attribute is not included in the snapshot on a JobMXBean.snapshot(int, boolean) or a JobMXBean.snapshot(int, boolean) call if includeStaticAttributes is false.

      Returns:
      the operator kind.
      Throws:

      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

      Note: Attribute change notification is supported for this attribute.

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • createOperationListener

      ObjectName createOperationListener()
      Creates an OperationListenerMXBean for tracking status messages associated with operations invoked on this bean. Once the operation listener is created, the listener Id can be passed as a parameter on operations which support it. An operation listener can be reused for multiple operation invocations; however, the behavior is undefined if it is used for concurrent operations. All existing messages are cleared at the start of each operation for which the listener is used. The unregister operation should be called on the operation listener after the listener is no longer needed to free the associated memory. All operation listeners are automatically unregistered when the monitored bean is unregistered. An operation listener is also automatically unregistered if it has had no activity for a certain amount of time. The inactivity time is controlled by the JMX_INACTIVITY_TIMEOUT property and is set to 30 minutes by default. If an operation listener bean is needed again, a new one can be created.
      Returns:
      the object name of the created listener bean.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.

    • retrieveApplicationTrace

      String retrieveApplicationTrace(String listenerId)
      Returns an HTTPS URI which can be used to access the application trace messages for the operator.
      Parameters:
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the trace messages in text/plain format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • OperationListenerMXBean

    • retrieveMetrics

      Set<Metric> retrieveMetrics(boolean includeAggregates)
      Retrieves the metric information and values for the operator. A metric is a measurement of an element associated with the operator.
      Parameters:
      includeAggregates - specifies whether aggregates of the operator's input and output port metrics should be included in the results. If true, the total tuples processed for all input ports will be included as well as the total tuples submitted for all output ports.
      Returns:
      the set of metrics for the operator.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • Metric
      • InstanceMXBean.retrieveJobSystemMetricMetadata()

    • retrieveProductLog

      String retrieveProductLog(String listenerId)
      Returns an HTTPS URI which can be used to access the Streams product log messages for the operator. The product log contains service and application messages for use by administrators, instance owners, and application developers.
      Parameters:
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the product log messages in text/plain format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • OperationListenerMXBean

    • retrieveProductLogMessages

      String retrieveProductLogMessages(String filters, String listenerId)
      Returns an HTTPS URI to retrieve a filtered set of messages for the operator from the Streams product log. If there are multiple rolling product logs, the contents of all are filtered from oldest to newest. The product log contains service and application messages for use by administrators, instance owners, and application developers.
      Parameters:
      filters - identifies the set of filters to apply to the product log messages. Only messages matching all filters are returned. The format of the filters value is a serialized string of a JSON object. Possible properties included in the object are:
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_CONTENT A regular expression string or an array of regular expression strings. Only messages containing content matching the specified regular expressions are returned.
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_LEVEL A string or an array of strings. Each value specifies a message log level. The value must be the value returned by LoggingPropertiesMXBean.Level.toString(). Only messages with the specified logging levels are returned.
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_COUNT An integer specifying the maximum number of messages to return.
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_START_TIME A long specifying a start time as the number of milliseconds since the epoch. Only messages with a timestamp after this time are returned.
      • LoggingPropertiesMXBean.FILTER_END_TIME A long specifying an end time as the number of milliseconds since the epoch. Only messages with a timestamp before or equal to this time are returned.
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      an HTTPS URI to access the filtered product log messages in text/plain format. This URI is valid for a single access for up to two minutes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if filters is not in the correct format or an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
